question_text: Select two differences between MSATA and M.2 SSDs.
answer_options: MSATA drives use PCIe, M.2 drives do not
M.2 supports NVMe, MSATA does not
MSATA has a larger physical footprint
M.2 allows for more interface flexibility
correct_answer: M.2 supports NVMe, MSATA does not
M.2 allows for more interface flexibility
explanation: MSATA is limited to SATA signaling. M.2 can support SATA or PCIe and allows NVMe support depending on the keying and controller.
